trans-unit.source: Encapsulates information about an HTTP request that matches a defined route.
The <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext> class contains information about the HTTP request in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.HttpContext%2A> property.
It contains information about the route that matched the current request in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.RouteData%2A> property.

When you construct a URL from a route, you pass an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext> class to the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Routing.RequestContext"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Routing.RequestContext"></xref> class.
An object that contains information about the HTTP request.
An object that contains information about the route that matched the current request.
Gets information about the HTTP request.

To set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.HttpContext%2A> property, you must pass the value as a parameter when you call the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.%23ctor%28System.Web.HttpContextBase%2CSystem.Web.Routing.RouteData%29> constructor.
An object that contains information about the HTTP request.
Gets information about the requested route.

To set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.RouteData%2A> property, you must pass the value as a parameter when you call the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.%23ctor%28System.Web.HttpContextBase%2CSystem.Web.Routing.RouteData%29> constructor.
An object that contains information about the requested route.
